text: this video is produced in collaboration
with think fin so today I'm going to
take you behind the camera and show you
a glimpse into my thought process and
how I go about filming my travel videos
first thing is packing it prep in a
backpack I bring my fully charged main
camera smaller secondary camera third
action camera plus the necessary
accessories batteries cleaning
toiletries phone water and of course a
snack travel is movement so I try and
make sure I get transport shots because
I don't just magically pop up in these
exotic locations when transiting I carry
around my backpack a lot and I'll
usually put my larger camera away and
then only use my smaller camera since
everything is happening really really
quick I like to mix up my footage
between cameras sometimes I fell with my
smaller vlog camera and sometimes a film
with my logic camera I do tend to use my
larger camera for introductions as well
as I use my microphone if I have space
to use my larger camera great or do I
feel more comfortable using my smaller
camera which I tend to use more so in
public spaces since it's less awkward
and draws less attention to me I try and
keep a good amount of camera movement in
my shots sometimes I'll grab two
different types of shots of the same
scenery just so that in editing I can
have options
I am also constantly getting b-roll
because I'm not sure of what kind of
story I want to tell what parts I want
to talk about and what will make the
best scenic visually beautiful shots a
lot of the times when I am alone and you
see the wandering off in the distance
shot it goes a little something like
this if I am by myself I'll set my
camera up on my backpack do my casual
walk and then run back and grab it if I
am in a busier place and I
place the camera down or if I want a
different angle I'll ask someone passing
by to take my photo or hold the camera
I'll line up the shot for them and then
I'll run off and I'll do my walk and
then I run back and thank them most
people are very willing to help me and
although it looks really silly in person
the shots usually turn out pretty great
filming travel videos can be a bit
hectic at times but I always prioritize
my own well-being and I choose to be
healthy and maintain balance whenever I
travel since I can't always make time
for exercise I actively choose
guilt-free options like thinking to have
with me on the go wherever I go
food is such an important part of making
sure I can keep going all day long and
have the energy I need to do all the
adventures I want to do if something
quirky catches my eye I'll quickly bring
up the vlog camera and capture it I
never know what's going to be around the
next corner so I've got to be quick I
like being spontaneous and not making
each activity or shop too far in events
one of the biggest things I've learned
as a travel vlogger is to be flexible
and patient because that leaves you open
to explore to see what you're able to do
at each destination and to see what
activities are available sometimes you
think you're going to film one thing and
then when you get there you change your
mind because hey this other activity
would actually make for better content
and better shots and last I do remember
to put down the camera once all the
filming is done and just take a chance
to enjoy nature and enjoy the place I'm
in after I've gotten the shots that I
